scene_hint.0: Show the walking state and evolution of organisms at different periods.

HwnB8aCn8yE_0.question: In which direction is the head of Dryopithecus tilted?
options: A. The head of Dryopithecus is slightly tilted upwards.
B. The head of Dryopithecus is tilted to the left.
C. The head of Dryopithecus is slightly tilted downwards.
D. The head of Dryopithecus is tilted to the right.

HwnB8aCn8yE_1.question: What does the background look like in the scene?
options: A. The background is completely white, with no other elements.
B. The background is a dense jungle with trees and vines.
C. The background is a gradient blue sky, dotted with clouds.
D. The background presents a laboratory with various scientific equipment.

HwnB8aCn8yE_2.question: What is the posture of Homo Sapiens, Modern?
options: A. It is an upright posture.
B. It is a quadrupedal posture.
C. It is a bent-over posture.
D. It is a lying down posture.

HwnB8aCn8yE_3.question: What is the action of Homo Sapiens, Modern?
options: A. Homo Sapiens, Modern is depicted as running, with both legs off the ground.
B. Homo Sapiens, Modern shows a steady walking motion.
C. Homo Sapiens, Modern is sitting on the ground, legs crossed, hands on knees.
D. Homo Sapiens, Modern is standing still, arms raised above the head.

HwnB8aCn8yE_4.question: What are the notable facial features of Dryopithecus?
options: A. Prominent facial contours with a raised mouth area
B. Flat face with no noticeable protrusions
C. Mouth with a sharp beak-like structure
D. Smooth, featureless facial contours

HwnB8aCn8yE_5.question: How many different images from different periods are described in the scene?
options: A. Eleven.
B. Twelve.
C. Thirteen.
D. Fourteen.

HwnB8aCn8yE_6.question: Is there visible text in the scene?
options: A. Yes, there is visible text in the scene.
B. No, there is no visible text in the scene.
D. No, only pictures are visible in the scene.
C. No, most of the scene is obscured, making it impossible to determine.

HwnB8aCn8yE_7.question: How does the body position of Dryopithecus give an impression of movement?
options: A. Dryopithecus is depicted in a quadrupedal posture, with forearms and legs supporting the body, leaning slightly forward.
B. Dryopithecus is depicted standing upright with arms extended to the sides, suggesting a stationary posture rather than movement.
C. Dryopithecus is depicted lying flat on its back with arms and legs extended, giving an impression of rest or inactivity.
D. Dryopithecus is depicted sitting cross-legged with arms resting on the knees, suggesting stillness without a sense of movement.

HwnB8aCn8yE_8.question: What was the survival period of Homo Sapiens Neanderthalensis?
options: A. Lived from 230,000 to 30,000 years ago.
B. Lived from 500,000 to 200,000 years ago.
C. Lived from 1.1 million to 230,000 years ago.
D. Lived from 1.8 million to 300,000 years ago.

HwnB8aCn8yE_9.question: What type of action does the posture of the Homo erectus image suggest?
options: A. The image shows a sitting posture in a resting state.
B. The posture conveys a relaxed walking action.
C. The image depicts a full-speed running action.
D. The posture indicates a squatting or climbing action.

HwnB8aCn8yE_10.question: What text is below the image of Australopithecus Robustus?
options: A. (Lived 2.1 – 1.6 million years ago)
B. (Lived 1.5 – 0.5 million years ago)
C. (Lived 2.3 – 0.3 million years ago)
D. (Lived 2.4 – 1.5 million years ago)

HwnB8aCn8yE_11.question: What does the text below the image of Australopithecus Boisei mean?
options: A. It indicates the evolutionary timeline and name of the image.
B. It provides a description of the ape's physical characteristics.
C. It outlines the artistic techniques used for creating the illustration.
D. It lists the scientific classification of primates.

options: A. Modern Homo Sapiens
B. Neanderthals
C. Australopithecus Afarensis
D. Homo erectus

HwnB8aCn8yE_17.question: Did Neanderthalensi appear before modern humans?
options: A. Yes, Neanderthalensi appeared before modern humans in the evolutionary sequence.
B. No, Neanderthalensi appeared after modern humans in the evolutionary sequence.

D. The order of appearance of Neanderthalensi and modern humans is not mentioned.

HwnB8aCn8yE_18.question: What is the sequence of events described in the video?
options: A. Transitioning from depictions of hominids to modern Homo sapiens, indicating the progress of evolution.
B. Transitioning from depictions of modern Homo sapiens to hominids, suggesting a reversal of evolution.
C. Switching between different extinct species without showing hominids or modern Homo sapiens.
D. Repeatedly showing hominids walking, with no depiction of Homo sapiens.

HwnB8aCn8yE_19.question: Why use minimalism and a white background when depicting in videos?
options: A. Highlight the evolution timeline with vibrant background colors.
B. Highlight their evolutionary significance without unnecessary distractions.
C. Create depth and realism in the illustrations.
D. Emphasize the environmental background of the subject's natural habitat.
